Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the photographed zebra is the only known golden zebra in existence, when in fact there have been reports of other "white zebras" in captivity.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the photographed zebra is the only known golden zebra in existence. The expert's verdict provides evidence of other "white zebras" in captivity, suggesting that there may be more than one.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photographed zebra is the only one of its kind based on the provided photograph, without considering the possibility of other similar zebras.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict suggests that the photograph has been digitally manipulated to make the zebra appear more "golden," indicating an alternative explanation for its appearance.
